alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 24 at 11:02PM CDT until June 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Southeastern Scott County in east central Iowa... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1101 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Credit Island, or over Davenport, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Riverdale and Rock Island Arsenal around 1115 PM CDT. Moline, Bettendorf, Rock Island County Fairgrounds and Campbells Island around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include East Moline, Silvis, Carbon Cliff, Silvis Heights, Hampton, Barstow, Colona, Cleveland, Dayton, Green River and Osborn. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
